gameCards.text: Let's build your GDG local community
I think this Rockstar speaker should be great for your event
This young promise might be good for this occassion
I would love to go to your event. I need to cover train tickets
Thanks for organize a GDG event! The event sounds awesome
I will help with that
Thanks for giving me the opportunity to participate in your event
I need help with my train ticket
Remember to keep expenses organized
Your previous meetup place offers to help with venue
You are awesome. We will help promoting the event
We have to delay the event 30 minutes
The superfancyplace does not anwser email
Superfancy place ask about GDG relation to Google
Superfancy place tells you that they dont have that day available
Superfancy place says next day might be possible
Speakers are alredy booked for that day. why change?
Time goes by. Open inscription for assistants
want to buy some ads?
You should share trends about the technology in your social media
You recieve an out of office email response from Almo
One of your speakers RTs you

left.text: put a tweet mentioning with event

gameCards.text: Other speaker FAVS you
A sucessful GDG community event ...
Diversity is key. I can help you to bring more women into your events
Time to make a list of the resources I need for the event
The event starts! Let's go
You presented the event , speakers name and techonolgy and tweet hastag

right.text: Thank the venue and give wifi password

gameCards.text: One of your speakers is getting more time in his talk
Are there any drinks or foods after the event?

right.text: No, this is not a birthday

left.text: Could you to the bar in the corner later alltogether

gameCards.text: 50 % of registered attendants show up
Where is the barthroom?
Twitter hastag is on and people is shy with it

left.text: use you GDG account to hype it

gameCards.text: Questions for the speaker are getting long

right.text: interrup kindly and aim to approach it later

gameCards.text: Thank you for making this event possible. You are doing great
A GDG community is ...
People are going to the bar! Great!

left.text: take one drink and say goodbye

gameCards.text: tweet : #GDG This event has been great. There is cool people here
You only had one speaker but it was nice
Food and drinks make people feel confortable and creates atmosphere

left.text: no! one more thing to do

gameCards.text: Can you write an entry for the blog?
The event ended . Yay !
I´ve heard the event was great for your first time as  a as GDG
Try to stick to a date for the events and not change it

right.text: I was trying to get fancy place

left.text: Ok,I understand It will be better

gameCards.text: You added to the community because you created a space for talented developers
Be aware that a GDG event is not for business as much as for developers
Thanks for showing interest in promoting diversity

right.text: I do it because you say so

gameCards.text: Diversity is both urgent and important for us
If you use Google tools like Google Drive, you can have direct access to organization documents

right.text: Will do, thanks for the recomendation

left.text: I do it with my notebook,thanks

gameCards.text: You showed organizational skills having all tidy in Google Drive. Congrats

left.text: I use drive since long time ago

gameCards.text: TIP :first appreciating similarities, second respecting differencies
A GDG community focuses on ...
Level 2 starts!
We can give you some budget for food and drinks

left.text: No more extra work for now

gameCards.text: What should we offer as food and drinks?
Thanks for thinking about us for your GDG event

right.text: Can you make a discount for recomendation?

left.text: Please be on time that day

gameCards.text: Give a voice to local talent is important for the community to grow
As part of the local community, I would love to give a talk !
I want to give a talk in the next meeting with this awesome new google tech

left.text: Yes because you can add value

gameCards.text: A GDG organizer saw your success on twitter and wants to come. Almo could cover costs

left.text: We are covered for this event

gameCards.text: Thanks for making room for my talk
Speakers seem to be solved . Send  email reminder
I would like to help you with the organization
Events doesn`t need to be big. They need to be great
A GDG organizer is not a king, is more like a custodian
You didn't introduce speakers by email to eachother
To gain trust with assistants and organizers ...
A gdg organizer from another city invites you to SLACK channel
We would love to host your event again with us
We can addecuate the place for food and drinks

left.text: Thanks! can we have a wellcome sign?

gameCards.text: We would love to help you with promotion, can we start ASAP?

left.text: Please, wait until I open inscriptions

gameCards.text: Feedback is the breakfast of champions, is there anything we can improve?

right.text: Can you help me with assistants hosting?

gameCards.text: Our place is the best in the city. We would like to hear about your event

right.text: I have alredy a place.Next time?

left.text: Now I dont want to know about you

gameCards.text: ok. Can I come to the event so we meet in person?

right.text: Great. You could see us in action

left.text: No. Let's meet in your place

gameCards.text: I would like to sponsor your event. I can pay you

left.text: Sounds good. what do you need?

gameCards.text: I need to post a roll up and my logo on your meetup page . Now
I would like to put a speaker to talk about one of my company's product

right.text: Does it use any google tech?

gameCards.text: If I give you the money, I need 30 RTs and email from people

right.text: I think that is ilegal by GDPR standards

gameCards.text: No. You must put it on advance and I'll pay afterwards
There should be a balance for sponsors with taking and giving
A great local developer community wants to partner for the event
Twitter is on fire and registrations are exceding your expectations

right.text: Breathe and tell venue.Sucess comes with response

left.text: Freak out and tell on twitter

gameCards.text: You had a strong disagreement with your coorganizer

left.text: grab for a coffee and talk

gameCards.text: A local newspaper wants to make you an interview

right.text: Ask GDG Spain comunication team for help

left.text: Ask co-organizer to take care of it

gameCards.text: There's a typo in the meetup page and you dont have time to fix it
The event starts! Let's go
One of speakers ate something and is sick. And not coming

left.text: Call a speaker friend and ask favor

gameCards.text: Half of the registered people came and extra chairs make place look empty
The Speaker's laptop HDMI connection doesn´t work
One of the talks is really terrible
You look sweety and nervious. Keep calm and go on
Your coorganizer is looking at you weirdly
The pizza guy is 10 minutes late
You are finally breathing. Your coorganizer did a good job
The event ended. Finally
The sponsor sends a unconfortable mail
One of your community members wants to go for a feedback coffee
Overall, people congratulate you and your coorganizer

left.text: Ask for negative feedback in survey

gameCards.text: You find a community organizer trolling about someone else
A community key is to searh for win-win situation for everyone
Sometimes it's important to not to give too much importance to things
Your coorganizer suggest you to let him/her manage sponsorship
Level 3 starts!
You are definetly a fast learner. It's time to make a devfest happen
There is a section in GDG wisdom about how to organize a devfest
2 days full of talks and activities! How shall we choose the content?
I can have a hangout with you and your coorganizers to help you with devfest

left.text: cool! take as many notes as possible

gameCards.text: There is a tremendous codelab that might be a perfect fit for the devfest

left.text: Ask a local friend to host it

gameCards.text: You would like to copy a web template but you have technical doubts
Devfest need sponsorship to correctly function
One of the possible sponsors ask you for a sponsorship draft

right.text: say that you dont have one

left.text: ask for more time and do it

gameCards.text: I suggest you a couple of international speakers
You opened a call4papers and you are recieving no applications

left.text: Maybe we should push it more

gameCards.text: One of your community members confess in a mail that he wants to help in organization

left.text: Grab for coffe and see what can do

gameCards.text: Your coorganizer is convinzed to open assistance registration asap
We would like to colaborate with you but we have no money

left.text: Pospond it untill money is assured

gameCards.text: I would like to offer a hackathon with arduino
Your coorganizer tells you that you could make a spreadsheet to improve organization
You make an aproximation for devfest budget and its more than expected
This seems to be more work than expected
A couple of volunteers are doing a really awesome job
We dont know exactly how many assistants we will have
We should automatize twitter material

right.text: Yes, ask a volunteer to set it up

left.text: Set up content and ask coorganizer for help

gameCards.text: Almo asks you about advacements but your coorganizer knows more about metrics

left.text: Set up a hangout for them and work in other stuff
